intro: Cirsium sordidum, commonly known as the sordid thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in dry grasslands and rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its spiny, gray-green foliage and purple to pinkish flower heads. It produces small, white to yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Cirsium sordidum is a perennial plant that can grow up to 1 meter tall, and it is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
